intro: Pedicularis jainii subsp. multiflora, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
